DataElement.preferredName: Serum Hepcidin Level Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome 0 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the serum hepcidin level.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serum Hepcidin Level Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed._Hepcidin (84 aa, ~9 kDa) is encoded by the human HAMP gene. This protein is involved in antimicrobial activity and iron absorption and storage._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:Hepcidin (84 aa, ~9 kDa) is encoded by the human HAMP gene. This protein is involved in antimicrobial activity and iron absorption and storage.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
Hepcidin (84 aa, ~9 kDa) is encoded by the human HAMP gene. This protein is involved in antimicrobial activity and iron absorption and storage.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome 0 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
